body_html:
I don't think this is a complete fix. I've seen the same error message show up in other circumstances, and I've finally found a good repro script:

torch.Tensor(5).fill_(math.floor(1e+40))

This is basically the same problem. math.floor returns an int, and because of this, it gets rerouted to unpackLong, even though it is used on an operation with a double tensor, and it is a value representable in the double format. You can check that:

float(math.floor(1e+40)) == 1e+40

I don't think this is a complete fix. I've seen the same error message show up in other circumstances, and I've finally found a good repro script:
torch.Tensor(5).fill_(math.floor(1e+40))
This is basically the same problem. math.floor returns an int, and because of this, it gets rerouted to unpackLong, even though it is used on an operation with a double tensor, and it is a value representable in the double format. You can check that:
float(math.floor(1e+40)) == 1e+40
body:
I don't think this is a complete fix. I've seen the same error message show up in other circumstances, and I've finally found a good repro script:
```python
torch.Tensor(5).fill_(math.floor(1e+40))
```
This is basically the same problem. `math.floor` returns an int, and because of this, it gets rerouted to `unpackLong`, even though it is used on an operation with a double tensor, and it is a value representable in the double format. You can check that:
```python
float(math.floor(1e+40)) == 1e+40
```
